TITLE: Oakland Cannabis Sellers, Once Full of Hope, Face a Harsh Reality
SUMMARY: The cannabis industry, designed in part to help communities upended by the war on drugs, is being threatened by theft, racism and a market that is stacked against small operators.

TITLE: New Yorkers With Marijuana Convictions Will Get First Retail Licenses
SUMMARY: Officials intend to reserve the first 100 or more retail licenses to sell marijuana in New York for people who have been convicted of related offenses, or their relatives.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes’s Ex-Boyfriend Set to Go on Trial in Theranos Case
SUMMARY: Jury selection started in Sunny Balwani’s fraud trial, which will establish just how much he knew about the blood-testing start-up Theranos and Ms. Holmes’s actions.

TITLE: Hollywood Bets Big on the Bad Entrepreneur
SUMMARY: With limited series like “The Dropout,” “WeCrashed” and “Super Pumped,” the culture is saturated with ripped-from-the-headlines tales of self-immolating moguls.

TITLE: You Quit Your Job, but You Still Need a Retirement Plan
SUMMARY: Millions of American workers said goodbye to their bosses last year. If you’re one, don’t lose sight of your savings and investment goals.

TITLE: Female Entrepreneurs Who Confront a Particular Kind of Troll
SUMMARY: Food companies founded by Asian American women find social media engagement with customers helps their growth, but they also face racist and sexist comments.

TITLE: Friends With Benefits Social Club Runs On Crypto and Vibes
SUMMARY: Friends With Benefits is a V.I.P. lounge for crypto’s creative class. Is it empty hype or the future of friendship?

TITLE: Anonymity in Crypto Raises Alarm
SUMMARY: Investors give money to pseudonymous developers. Venture capitalists back founders without learning their real names. What happens when they need to know?

TITLE: A Spotlight on Tech’s Invisible Start-ups
SUMMARY: A new how-to guide aims to support the start-ups that are chugging along and doing just fine.

TITLE: In Detroit, a Bet That Healthy Restaurants Can Help the City
SUMMARY: For years, a coalition of groups has supported food businesses, seeing them as critical to the city’s continuing recovery. The pandemic has put its accomplishments to the test.

TITLE: Nightlife Inflation: Why Drink Prices and Entrance Fees are going up
SUMMARY: Surging prices are taking a toll on a night on the town. “I remember just going ‘yikes’ when signing off on a nearly $80 bill,” a bar patron said.

TITLE: Ambitions and Emotions Run Hot in ‘The Founders,’ a History of PayPal
SUMMARY: Jimmy Soni’s book tells the story of how an ensemble of entrepreneurs, including Elon Musk and Peter Thiel, helped the online payment system prevail.

TITLE: Glimpses of Northern India’s Vanishing Nomads
SUMMARY: For centuries, Kharnak nomads have raised livestock in one of the most hauntingly beautiful — and inhospitable — places on earth. Can their traditions outlast a generational exodus?

TITLE: Running a Business Under the Shadow of War
SUMMARY: “When you’re constantly thinking about invading Russians you’re not going to go buy a new phone, or a car, or a house.”

TITLE: More Brew and Less Buzz, With Low-Alcohol Beers
SUMMARY: While all the attention goes to the extremes — strong ales and alcohol-free beers — craft brewers are increasingly aiming for the sweet spot in the middle.

TITLE: What Elizabeth Holmes and Theranos Reveal About Venture Capitalism
SUMMARY: Silicon Valley’s big investors are not like the rest of us.

TITLE: Tech Start-Ups Reach a New Peak of Froth
SUMMARY: There’s more money and more bubbly behavior. Investors insist it’s rational.

TITLE: Facebook Rejected Ads From 60 Women's Sexual Health Companies According to New Report
SUMMARY: A new report found that the social network has rejected ads from 60 companies focused on women’s sexual health, citing policies on “adult products and services.”

TITLE: What It Was Like on the Elizabeth Holmes Jury for 18 Weeks
SUMMARY: Away from the media frenzy, jurors dealt with the trial’s disruption to their lives and had little idea of the case’s implications.

TITLE: Sara Menker and Gro Intelligence Are Tackling Global Hunger
SUMMARY: The Ethiopian entrepreneur Sara Menker founded Gro Intelligence, which uses artificial intelligence to forecast global agricultural trends and battle food insecurity.
